description: Purpose of financial accounting, users of information, and key qualitative characteristics and basic accounting concepts.
Ledger accounts, the accounting equation, debits and credits, and recording basic sales, purchases and cash transactions.
Basic inventory valuation methods, cost vs net realisable value, and treatment of trade receivables and allowances for doubtful debts.
Recognition of property, plant and equipment, capital vs revenue expenditure, depreciation methods and disposals.
Recognition of intangible assets, internally generated vs purchased goodwill, and simple treatment of impairment and write-downs.
Accrual basis of accounting and adjustments for accrued and prepaid expenses and income, and their effect on profit and balances.
Purpose of the trial balance, types of errors, use of suspense accounts and correcting errors to adjust the trial balance.

unit_name: Financial statements for a sole trader
description: Structure of basic profit or loss and financial position statements and how year-end adjustments feed into them.
Difference between profit and cash, common cash inflows and outflows, and simple classification of cash movements.
Simple profitability, liquidity and efficiency ratios and basic interpretation of performance, position and limitations of ratio analysis.
